intro: Pilosella blyttiana, commonly known as the Blyttian goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Pilosella blyttiana is often found in open, disturbed habitats and is considered a short-lived perennial.
